column17: Source

(1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects, (2) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (3) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (4) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Report (various years), (5) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database, and (6) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme.

Derived from total population. Population source: (1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects, (2) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (3) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (4) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Reprot (various years), (5) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database, and (6) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme.
Food and Agriculture Organization, electronic files and web site.

column3: Population density (people per sq. km of land area)
column17: Food and Agriculture Organization and World Bank population estimates.

column3: Poverty headcount ratio at national poverty lines (% of population)
column17: World Bank, Global Poverty Working Group. Data are compiled from official government sources or are computed by World Bank staff using national (i.e. country–specific) poverty lines.

column3: Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)
column17: World Bank, Development Research Group. Data are based on primary household survey data obtained from government statistical agencies and World Bank country departments. Data for high-income economies are from the Luxembourg Income Study database. For more information and methodology, please see PovcalNet (http://iresearch.worldbank.org/PovcalNet/index.htm).
World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.

column3: GNI per capita, Atlas method (current US$)
column17: World Bank national accounts data, and OECD National Accounts data files.
World Bank, International Comparison Program database.
World Bank, International Comparison Program database.

World Bank, Development Research Group. Data are based on primary household survey data obtained from government statistical agencies and World Bank country departments. Data for high-income economies are from the Luxembourg Income Study database. For more information and methodology, please see PovcalNet (http://iresearch.worldbank.org/PovcalNet/index.htm).

Derived from male and female life expectancy at birth from sources such as: (1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects, (2) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (3) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (4) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Reprot (various years), (5) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database, and (6) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme.

(1) United Nations Population Division. World Population Prospects, (2) Census reports and other statistical publications from national statistical offices, (3) Eurostat: Demographic Statistics, (4) United Nations Statistical Division. Population and Vital Statistics Reprot (various years), (5) U.S. Census Bureau: International Database, and (6) Secretariat of the Pacific Community: Statistics and Demography Programme.

column3: Adolescent fertility rate (births per 1,000 women ages 15-19)
column17: United Nations Population Division, World Population Prospects.

column3: Contraceptive prevalence, any methods (% of women ages 15-49)
column17: UNICEF's State of the World's Children and Childinfo, United Nations Population Division's World Contraceptive Use, household surveys including Demographic and Health Surveys and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys.

column3: Births attended by skilled health staff (% of total)
column17: UNICEF, State of the World's Children, Childinfo, and Demographic and Health Surveys.

Estimates Developed by the UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UNICEF, WHO, World Bank, UN DESA Population Division) at www.childmortality.org. Projected data are from the United Nations Population Division's World Population Prospects; and may in some cases not be consistent with data before the current year.

column3: Prevalence of underweight, weight for age (% of children under 5)
column17: World Health Organization, Global Database on Child Growth and Malnutrition. Country-level data are unadjusted data from national surveys, and thus may not be comparable across countries. Adjusted, comparable data are available at http://www.who.int/nutgrowthdb/en. Aggregation is based on UNICEF, WHO, and the World Bank harmonized dataset (adjusted, comparable data) and methodology.

column3: Immunization, measles (% of children ages 12-23 months)
column17: WHO and UNICEF (http://www.who.int/immunization/monitoring_surveillance/en/).

column3: Primary completion rate, total (% of relevant age group)
column17: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

column3: Gross enrollment ratio, primary, both sexes (%)
column17: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

column3: Gross enrolment ratio, secondary, both sexes (%)
column17: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

column3: School enrollment, primary and secondary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
column17: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Institute for Statistics.

column3: Prevalence of HIV, total (% of population ages 15-49)
column17: UNAIDS estimates.
Food and Agriculture Organization, electronic files and web site.

column3: Terrestrial and marine protected areas (% of total territorial area)
column17: United Nations Environmental Program and the World Conservation Monitoring Centre, as compiled by the World Resources Institute, based on data from national authorities, national legislation and international agreements.

column3: Annual freshwater withdrawals, total (% of internal resources)
column17: Food and Agriculture Organization, AQUASTAT data.

column3: Improved water source (% of population with access)
column17: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply and Sanitation (http://www.wssinfo.org/).

column17: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme (JMP) for Water Supply and Sanitation (http://www.wssinfo.org/).
